{{See also|SUSE Linux distributions}} {{Infobox OS | name = SUSE Linux Enterprise Server Edition | logo = [[Image:Suse logo.svg|100px|SLES logo]] | screenshot = [[Image:OS11.2-menu-dolphin.png|300px]] | caption = SUSE Linux 11 with KDE 4.3 | website = [http://www.suse.com/products/server/ SUSE Linux Enterprise Server] | developer = [[SUSE]] | family = [[Linux]] | source_model = [[Open source]] | released = March {{birth year and age|1994}} | latest_release_version = 11 SP1 | latest_release_date = {{release date|2010|5|19}}<ref name="SLES11sp1" /> | latest_test_version = <!--11.1 RC1--> | latest_test_date = <!--{{release date|2008|11|27}}<ref>[http://news.opensuse.org/2008/11/27/development-release-opensuse-111-rc-1-now-available/ Development Release: openSUSE 11.1 RC 1 Now Available]</ref>--> | marketing_target = [[business|commercial]] market (include [[Mainframe computer|Mainframes]], [[Server (computing)|Server]]s, [[Workstation]]s, [[Supercomputer]]s) | language = Multilingual | kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel|Monolithic]] ([[Linux kernel|Linux]]) | userland = [[GNU Core Utilities|GNU]] | ui = [[KDE Plasma Workspaces|KDE Plasma Desktop]], [[GNOME]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] and Various. | working_state = Current | supported_platforms = [[IA-32]], [[x86-64]], [[s390x]], [[PowerPC]], [[Itanium]] | updatemodel = [[Zypper]]/[[YaST2]] | package_manager = [[RPM Package Manager]] }}
'''SUSE Linux Enterprise Server''' ('''SLES''') is a [[Linux distribution]] supplied by [[SUSE]] and targeted at the business market. It is targeted for [[server (computing)|server]]s, [[Mainframe computer|mainframe]]s, and [[workstation]]s but can be installed on [[desktop computer]]s for testing as well. New major versions are released at an interval of 3-4 years, while minor versions (called service packs) are released about every 18 months. SUSE Linux Enterprise products, including SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, receive much more intense testing than the [[openSUSE]] community product, with the intention that only mature, stable versions of the included components will make it through to the released enterprise product.
The current version is SLES 11 SP1, released May 19, 2010, which is developed from a common codebase with [[SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop]] and other SUSE Linux Enterprise products.
==History== SLES has been developed based on SUSE Linux by a small team led by Marcus Kraft and Bernhard Kaindl as principal developer who was supported by Joachim SchrÃ¶der. It was first released on 31 October 2000 as a version for [[IBM]] [[S/390]] mainframe machines.<ref>SuSE: [http://web.archive.org/web/20010605154144/www.suse.de/en/produkte/susesoft/s390/S390release.html "SuSE Linux for S/390 available today"]</ref> In December 2000, the first enterprise client ([[TeliaSonera|Telia]]) was made public.<ref>silicon.com: [http://hardware.silicon.com/desktops/0,39024645,11021413,00.htm "Linux mainframe ousts Sun servers at Telia"]</ref> In April 2001, the first SLES for [[x86]] was released.
'''SLES version 9''' was released in August 2004. Service Pack 4 was released in December 2007. It is supported by the major hardware vendorsâ[[IBM]], [[Hewlett-Packard|HP]], [[Sun Microsystems]], [[Dell, Inc.|Dell]], [[Silicon Graphics|SGI]], [[Lenovo]], and [[Fujitsu Siemens Computers]].
SLES 9 is installed on [[NASA]]'s [[supercomputer]] ''[[Columbia (supercomputer)|Columbia]]''.<ref>[http://www.nas.nasa.gov/Resources/Systems/columbia.html NAS Computing Resources - Columbia Supercomputer]</ref>
'''SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10''' was released in July 2006<ref>[http://www.novell.com/news/press/item.jsp?id=1031 "Novell Delivers Next-Generation Platform for the Open Enterprise"]</ref>, and is also supported by the major hardware vendors. Service pack 4 was released in April 2011. <ref>[http://www.novell.com/news/press/2011/4/novell-offers-industrys-longest-enterprise-linux-support-program-.html Novell Offers Industry's Longest Enterprise Linux Support Program]</ref>SLES 10 shares a common codebase with [[SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop|SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 10]]âNovell's desktop distribution for business useâand other SUSE Linux Enterprise products.
The front node of [[JUGENE]], a petaflops supercomputer at the [[JÃ¼lich Research Centre]] in [[Germany]], uses SLES 10 as its operating system. [[File:Suse 11.JPG|thumb|left|Enterprise Server 11 installation discs]] '''SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11''' was released on March 24, 2009 <ref name="SLES11">[http://www.novell.com/news/press/2009/3/novell-ships-suse-linux-enterprise-11.html Novell Ships SUSE Linux Enterprise 11]</ref> and include [[Linux kernel|Linux kernel 2.6.27]], [[Oracle Cluster File System]] 2, support for the [[OpenAIS]] cluster communication protocol for server and storage clustering, and [[Mono (software)|Mono]] 2.0.<ref>{{cite news |first=Timothy Prickett |last=Morgan |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Novell Previews Features in SUSE Linux Enterprise 11 |url=http://www.itjungle.com/tlb/tlb032508-story01.html |work=The Linux Beacon |publisher= |date=2008-03-25 |accessdate= }}</ref> SLES 11 SP1 (released May 2010) rebased the kernel version to 2.6.32.<ref name="SLES11sp1">[http://www.novell.com/news/press/novell-announces-suse-linux-enterprise-11-service-pack-1/ Novell Announces SUSE Linux Enterprise 11 Service Pack 1]</ref>
IBM's [[Watson_(artificial_intelligence_software)|Watson]] was built on IBM's [[Power7]] systems using SLES. <ref>{{cite | title=IBM Watson runs SUSE Linux Enterprise Server | url=http://www.novell.com/promo/suse/ibm-watson.html | date=2011-02-15 | accessdate=2011-02-15 | publisher = Novell, Inc. }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==Version history==
Release dates of SUSE Linux Enterprise Server versions.<ref name="lifecycle">{{cite web | url=http://support.novell.com/lifecycle/ |title=Novell Support Lifecycle |accessdate=2011-08-11}}</ref>
* SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 9 ** Initial release, 2004-08-03 ** SP1, 2005-01-19 ** SP2, 2005-07-07 ** SP3, 2005-12-22 ** SP4, 2007-12-12
* SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10 ** Initial release, 2006-06-17 ** SP1, 2007-06-18 ** SP2, 2008-05-19 ** SP3, 2009-10-12 ** SP4, 2011-04-12
* SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 ** Initial release, 2009-03-24 ** SP1, 2010-06-02
==Product integration and bundles== SLES is also an important part of [[Novell Open Enterprise Server]], which brings all the networking services that were previously available only on [[NetWare]] to the Linux platform.
==Hypervisor kernels supported== SLES 10: *[[Xen]] 3.2
SLES 11 SP1: *[[Xen]] 4.0 *kvm is also supported
